messages.content: What is the purpose of the Chatbox Overlay node in ComfyUI?
The Chatbox Overlay node in ComfyUI is designed to add a text box over a processed image before the image is saved.
How do you install the Chatbox Overlay node in ComfyUI?

To install the Chatbox Overlay node in ComfyUI, you first need to download the python file and place it in the customnodes directory of your ComfyUI installation path. After placing the file, restart ComfyUI. Then, you can add the node by searching for "Chatbox Overlay" just before your save node.
What are the recommended steps to follow when using the Chatbox Overlay node?

When using the Chatbox Overlay node, it is recommended to save and load your image into ComfyUI, adjust the start locations based on your image axis in pixels, and fine-tune the font location as per your system's requirements, such as font file path for Windows systems.
Can you provide an example workflow using the Chatbox Overlay node?

Sure! Here is a sample workflow: 1. Save and load your image into ComfyUI. 2. Adjust the start locations based on your image size. 3. Fine-tune the font location according to your system's requirements.
What is the intended use of the Chatbox Overlay node?
The Chatbox Overlay node is intended to be used for adding a text box to an image before it is saved in ComfyUI.
How do you move the Chatbox Overlay node within ComfyUI?
To move the Chatbox Overlay node within ComfyUI, you would need to adjust the start locations and font location based on your image's dimensions and font requirements, respectively.
Are there any limitations or requirements for using the Chatbox Overlay node in ComfyUI?

Yes, there are some limitations and requirements for using the Chatbox Overlay node in ComfyUI. It requires knowledge of image processing and font configurations, and it is important to adjust the start locations and font location based on the dimensions of the image and font requirements, respectively.
